note.p: Birth: The Manse, Barry, Forfarshire, Scotland (19 December 1832)

Career: Served in a hospital in the Dardanells during the Crimean War; Chief Officer to Dr Livingstone's second African expedition (1858-1864); Physician to the consulate of Zanzibar (1866); Vice-Consul (1867); Consul (1873); Political agent, Zanzibar (1886); Consul General; retired from the Consular Service (1887); British Plenipotentiary to the African Conference, Brussels (1889-1890); a founder and Director of the British East African Company; Kirk Range, in the Rift Valley, named after him, as is Kirk's Gazelle
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series B 1922-1923 vol 94 pp xi-xxx signed by D P
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
